#15Mi interes es no caer en las estafas de empresas que venden paraisos difrutables despues de la muerte.

La filosofia personal evoluciona con el tiempo y en libertad. Nadie debe condicionar el criterio o creencias propias.
En mi opinion, el universo es una paradoja, no estamos acostumbrados a pensar asi. El universo se define sobre si mismo. Es decir, existe porque quiere. De igualâ€¦

author: Mike Taylor
title: Clean tech company makes major breakthrough while working with shredded batteries: 'A significant leap forward'
text:
A clean tech company is stretching the limits of sustainable electric vehicle batteries.
Adionics announced in September that it had extracted high-purity lithium from shredded lithium-ion batteries, Hart Energy reported. The process promises to reduce lithium mining with a 98% recovery rate from black mass, which is made from discarded anode and cathode materials.
Called direct lithium extraction , it can be done at any stage of the recycling process. The liquid-liquid method does not use acid, produce toxic waste, or require overseas processing.
EVs are already great for our health, our wallets, and the planet, but even cleaner cars and batteries ? That's what we're looking toward with this and other developments in battery technology.
"The new version of the Flionex represents a significant leap forward in promoting a truly circular economy for lithium-ion," Adionics CEO Gabriel Toffani said in a news release.
"The versatility, combined with the ability to process battery black mass, positions Adionics at the forefront of sustainable lithium production."
Watch now: Would you wear a shirt made out of oysters? This is great news for the future of EVs, which are helping people, corporations, and governments divest from dirty energy sources â€” the driving force behind the heating of the planet that is pushing livable conditions out of reach around the world.
Heat waves in particular are stressing humans and wildlife , though other weather events, such as droughts and floods, displace tens of millions of people each year.
EVs produce zero tailpipe pollution and outdo internal combustion engine vehicles even with their enormous batteries . That's a common knock on the green machines, but it shouldn't be.
ðŸ—£ï¸ If you're thinking about buying an EV, which of these factors is most likely to convince you that it's a smart decision? ðŸ”˜ Seeing friends and family buy EVs ðŸ‘¯ ðŸ”˜ Seeing first responders use EVs ðŸš’ ðŸ”˜ Seeing businesses use EVs ðŸš• ðŸ”˜ Seeing celebrities drive EVs ðŸ¤© ðŸ—³ï¸ Click your choice to see results and speak your mind EV batteries require the extraction of millions of tons of metals from the ground, but gas-guzzlers and other carbon-heavy products and industries depend on billions of tons of coal, gas, and oil â€” and those fossil fuels cannot be reused, whereas batteries can be recycled at up to 95% efficiency .
So, let's work harder and faster to move away from the things that are holding us back. You can start by â€” and feel good about â€” making your next vehicle an EV .
Join our free newsletter for weekly updates on the latest innovations improving our lives and shaping our future , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet.

text: Au Real Madrid, lâ€™Ã©tÃ© semble assez calme, pourtant, en coulisses, les dirigeants merengue semblent sâ€™agiter. Câ€™est notamment le cas dâ€™Antonio RÃ¼diger, qui serait pistÃ© en Arabie saoudite, mais le dÃ©fenseur central voudrait rester au Santiago BernabÃ©u. Si le [Real Madrid](https://le10sport.com/football/mercato/mercato-l-om-va-debloquer-un-transfert-du-real-madrid-706398) a fait les gros titres ces derniÃ¨res semaines suite Ã  lâ€™arrivÃ©e de [Kylian MbappÃ©](https://le10sport.com/football/espagne/real-madrid/mbappe-arrive-le-real-madrid-annonce-la-couleur-706434), plusieurs Ã©lÃ©ments des Champions dâ€™Europe intÃ©ressent des Ã©curies venues dâ€™Europe, mais pas seulement. Alors quâ€™Antonio RÃ¼diger semblait Ãªtre pistÃ© par Al-Ittihad, lâ€™Allemand nâ€™aurait aucune envie de quitter le club merengue. Mercato - Real Madrid : Une nouvelle star va rejoindre MbappÃ© ?â€” le10sport (@le10sport) [https://t.co/hwAUmaJoTv] [pic.twitter.com/kv3hH5qL6l] [July 24, 2024] Antonio RÃ¼diger concentrÃ© sur le Real Madrid Dâ€™aprÃ¨s les informations de Fabrizio Romano, Antonio RÃ¼diger nâ€™envisagerait absolument pas de quitter le Real Madrid, malgrÃ© une grosse proposition de la part dâ€™Al-Ittihad. Le journaliste explique que le dÃ©fenseur central est totalement focalisÃ© sur son aventure madrilÃ¨ne, et que les Merengue souhaitent eux aussi continuer avec lâ€™ancien joueur de Chelsea dans leurs rangs. Une hÃ©catombe en dÃ©fense centrale Avec Antonio RÃ¼diger comme patron dans ce secteur du jeu cette saison, le Real Madrid ne peut pas se permettre de voir partir lâ€™Allemand. Alors que David Alaba est toujours Ã  lâ€™infirmerie, quâ€™Eder MilitÃ£o revient Ã  peine dâ€™une grave blessure au genou et que Nacho a annoncÃ© son dÃ©part pour lâ€™Arabie saoudite, un dÃ©part du joueur de 31 ans paraÃ®t impossible pour les pensionnaires de Santiago BernabÃ©u.

author: Sami E. Turner
title: For the Safety of Jews and Palestinians, Stop Weaponizing Antisemitism | Opinion | The Harvard Crimson
text:
This op-ed is part of a special opinion package, â€œAntisemitism at Harvard, According to Seven Jewish Affiliates.â€ View the full package here.
For eighteen years I had the great privilege of working as Executive Director of Harvard Hillel.
As a leader of Jewish communities on campus, in New England, and around the nation, I have helped cultivate a new generation of Jewish leaders and citizens. I navigated moments of tension and war: the tumultuous 1990s, as the Oslo Accords began to crumble; the Second Intifada; 9/11 and its fallout; the Iraq War; Israelâ€™s Second Lebanon War and its war on Gaza in late 2008.
During my long career as a Jewish educator and leader â€” including thirteen years living in Jerusalem â€” I have seen and lived through my communityâ€™s struggles. Now, as an elder leader, with the benefit of hindsight, I feel compelled to speak to what I see as a disturbing trend gripping our campus, and many others: The cynical weaponization of antisemitism by powerful forces who seek to intimidate and ultimately silence legitimate criticism of Israel and of American policy on Israel.
In most cases, it takes the form of bullying pro-Palestine organizers . In others, these campaigns persecute anyone who simply doesnâ€™t show due deference to the bullies.
The recent effort to smear our new University President, Claudine Gay, is a case in point. I applaud the decision by the Harvard Corporation to stand by Dr. Gay amid the ludicrous charges that she somehow supports genocide against Jews, and I hope Harvard will continue to take a clear and strong stance against any further efforts by these powerful parties to meddle in university affairs, especially over personnel decisions.
The toppling of the president of the University of Pennsylvania is a sobering example of what can happen when we empower these unscrupulous forces to dictate our path as university leaders. The stakes are as high as theyâ€™ve ever been. Our vigilance must be up to the task.
As a leader in the Jewish community, I am particularly alarmed by todayâ€™s McCarthyist tactic of manufacturing an antisemitism scare, which, in effect, turns the very real issue of Jewish safety into a pawn in a cynical political game to cover for Israelâ€™s deeply unpopular policies with regard to Palestine. (A recent poll found that 66 percent of all U.S. voters and 80 percent of Democratic voters desire an end to Israelâ€™s current war, for instance.)
What makes this trend particularly disturbing is the power differential: Billionaire donors and the politically-connected, non-Jews and Jews alike on one side, targeting disproportionately people of vulnerable populations on the other, including students, untenured faculty, persons of color, Muslims, and, especially, Palestinian activists.
Advertisement Let me speak directly to Jewish students at Harvard.
I know that itâ€™s alienating and hurtful to so many of you when campus Jewish organizations, like Hillel and Chabad, take positions that exclude your voices. To those students, I say: The Jewish tradition is much deeper than any organization. No one has a monopoly on Judaism.
Continue to learn Torah, Jewish history, and our ethical traditions. Continue to draw from these sources â€” your sources â€” to find yourself, to build community, to build your own power, and even to build your own Jewish organizations.
Be boldly critical of Israel â€” not despite being Jewish, but because you are. There is no tradition more central to Judaism than prophetic truth-telling, no Jewish imperative more urgent than bravely criticizing corrupt leadership, starting with our own.
As someone who spent over forty years running programs in which Jews, often young people, were under my care, the safety of Jews has always been my highest priority â€” and, frankly, the thing that keeps me up at night. I have myself been the victim of antisemitism, including, on more than one occasion, serious violent attack.
I know what antisemitism looks like and I do not take the issue of violence against Jews lightly. I have monitored, with vigilance, the kinds of speech that Israel-aligned parties are calling â€œantisemitic,â€ and it simply does not pass the sniff test.
Let me speak plainly: It is not antisemitic to demand justice for all Palestinians living in their ancestral lands.
The activists who employ this language, and the politics of liberation, are sincere people; their cause is a legitimate and important movement dissenting against the brutal treatment of Palestinians that has been ongoing for 75 years. One can disagree with any part of what these activists say, but they must be allowed to speak safely and afforded the respect their morally serious position deserves. I have learned much by listening and carefully considering the positions of these activists.
If Israelâ€™s cause is just, let it speak eloquently in its own defense. It is very telling that some of Israelâ€™s own supporters instead go to extraordinary lengths to utterly silence the other side. Smearing oneâ€™s opponents is rarely a tactic employed by those confident that justice is on their side. If Israelâ€™s case requires branding its critics antisemites, it is already conceding defeat.
Let me be clear: Antisemitism in the U.S. is a real and dangerous phenomenon, most pressingly from the alt-right white-supremacist politics that have become alarmingly mainstream since 2016. To contend against these and other antisemitic forces with clarity and purpose, we must put aside all fabricated and weaponized charges of â€œantisemitismâ€ that serve to silence criticism of Israeli policy and its sponsors in the U.S.
Advertisement As a Jewish leader, I say: Enough.
Bernie Steinberg was the executive director of Harvard Hillel from 1993 to 2010.

author: Osviel Castro Medel digital cu
title: Cuba rinde homenaje al Padre de la Patria - Juventud Rebelde - Diario de la juventud cubana
text: Un sentido tributo a CÃ©spedes, encabezado por el vicepresidente de la RepÃºblica, Salvador ValdÃ©s, tuvo lugar en la Plaza de la RevoluciÃ³n, de Bayamo Autor: IbrahÃ­n SÃ¡nchez Carrillo Publicado: 18/04/2024 | 02:31 pm BAYAMO, Granma.â€” La vida y obra de Carlos Manuel de CÃ©spedes, Padre de la Patria (18 de abril de 1819- 27 de febrero de 1874), fueron resaltadas este jueves en solemne acto de homenaje, tributo que estuvo encabezado por Salvador ValdÃ©s Mesa, miembro del BurÃ³ PolÃ­tico y Vicepresidente de la RepÃºblica. Frente a la casa natal donde naciera el patriota, varios artistas de Granma repasaron, con dramatizaciones, canciones y fragmentos de poemas, momentos de la trayectoria del Iniciador, quien vio la luz en la antigua calle Burruchaga, hace 205 aÃ±os. El orador en el acto fue el Doctor en Ciencias Yoel CordovÃ­, presidente del Instituto de Historia de Cuba, quien resaltÃ³ la personalidad del HÃ©roe de San Lorenzo, un hombre que no fue entendido por todos sus contemporÃ¡neos, a pesar de haber sido el primero en levantarse en armas contra la metrÃ³poli espaÃ±ola. Â«Desde la altura de su sÃ­mbolo, con fuerza como la luz llega su ejemplo, la Ã©tica revolucionaria, la indoblegable fe en el triunfo de una causa justaÂ», expresÃ³ el destacado historiador. En la congregaciÃ³n estuvieron ademÃ¡s cientos de bayameses, Alpidio Alonso Grau, Ministro de Cultura, Yanetsy Terry GutiÃ©rrez, Gobernadora de Granma, y participantes en el 32da ediciÃ³n de la jornada cientÃ­fica Creador de la Patria, que convocÃ³ a prestigiosos investigadores el paÃ­s, incluyendo a Eduardo Torres Cuevas, merecedor del Premio Nacional de Historia. Antes del acto se desarrollÃ³, con la presencia del Comandante de la RevoluciÃ³n y miembro del BurÃ³ PolÃ­tico Ramiro ValdÃ©s MenÃ©ndez, la ceremonia de las banderas, que consiste en izar, en la Plaza de la RevoluciÃ³n, de esta ciudad, el estandarte nacional y el de Carlos Manuel de CÃ©spedes. El homenaje al prÃ³cer independentista incluyÃ³ la cancelaciÃ³n de un sello postal alegÃ³rico al patricio, la develaciÃ³n de la obra Nacimiento de un Padre, del artista de la plÃ¡stica Alexis Pantoja PÃ©rez, la iluminaciÃ³n de un cuadro del Primer Presidente y la conferencia Â«Ã‰tica y RevoluciÃ³n en Carlos Manuel de CÃ©spedesÂ», dictada por Yoel CordovÃ­. Todas estas actividades se celebraron en la Casa Natal del ilustre bayamÃ©s, hoy convertida en museo. Asimismo, las actividades por el 205 aniversario del Hombre de La Demajagua, comprendieron el evento CanciÃ³n al Padre, desarrollado por la AsociaciÃ³n Hermanos SaÃ­z para recordar con trova y arte al Fundador, quien fue coautor de La Bayamesa, considerada la primera obra musical romÃ¡ntica de Cuba.

Ne buvez sous aucun prÃ©texte lâ€™eau de riviÃ¨re, lâ€™eau du puits ou lâ€™eau de pluie !

Circulation des personnes :
En lien avec le Conseil dÃ©partemental, il a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©cidÃ© lâ€™arrÃªt complet de la circulation des barges Ã  compter de 17h30 ce vendredi :

Lâ€™aÃ©roport de Mayotte fermera ses portes aprÃ¨s le dÃ©part du dernier avion Ã  18h50 Ã  destination de Paris. La derniÃ¨re arrivÃ©e sâ€™effectuera Ã  14h40, les passagers rÃ©sidant sur Grande Terre doivent traverser sans attendre aprÃ¨s lâ€™atterrissage. Lâ€™aÃ©roport restera fermÃ© jusquâ€™Ã  nouvel ordre.
Accueil de la jeunesse :
Dans ce cadre, les Ã©tablissements scolaires, les crÃ¨ches, les accueils pÃ©riscolaires, et tous les accueils collectifs de mineurs avec ou sans hÃ©bergement sont fermÃ©s depuis ce vendredi matin Ã  7h et cela jusquâ€™Ã  nouvel ordre.
CONSIGNES DE PRÃ‰PARATION Faire des stocks et se prÃ©parer Ã  Ãªtre isolÃ© quelques heures/jours : Gardez prÃ¨s de vous lâ€™Ã©quipement nÃ©cessaire (eau, nourriture, lampe de poche, papiers dâ€™identitÃ©, trousse de secours). PrÃ©parez-vous Ã  une Ã©vacuation potentielle PrÃ©parer son habitation : Consolider et protÃ©ger les ouvertures, et notamment les fenÃªtres (volets, planchesâ€¦), Mettre Ã  lâ€™abri tout ce qui pourrait Ãªtre emportÃ© par le vent, PrÃ©parer la piÃ¨ce la plus sÃ»re de lâ€™habitation pour vous accueillir durant le passage du phÃ©nomÃ¨ne, Faire connaÃ®tre le choix de votre abri Ã  votre entourage et sâ€™y tenir, Mettre les animaux Ã  l'abri, Garer son vÃ©hicule dans un endroit protÃ©gÃ©. PrÃ©parer son bateau : Il est impÃ©ratif de bien amarrer son bateau comme les prÃ©conisations lâ€™indiquent en cas dâ€™Ã©vÃ¨nement houleux,
Les personnes habitant sur un bateau sont invitÃ©es Ã  le quitter pour trouver abri sur terre, les mairies sont Ã  disposition pour trouver lieu dâ€™hÃ©bergement.
Savoir impÃ©rativement oÃ¹ vous vous mettrez Ã  lâ€™abri :
Il faut un hÃ©bergement en dur, qui ne soit pas en bordure de ravine, de riviÃ¨re, de mer, ou en zone inondable : chez vous, chez un voisin, de la famille ou dans un centre dâ€™hÃ©bergement, pour ceux qui en ont besoin.
Plusieurs centres dâ€™hÃ©bergement sont en cours de mise en place par les communes : se renseigner auprÃ¨s de sa mairie ;
Vie Ã©conomique : La vie Ã©conomique de lâ€™Ã®le nâ€™est pas interrompue par le niveau orange de lâ€™alerte cyclonique. NÃ©anmoins, les employeurs sont invitÃ©s Ã  prendre en compte cette alerte et Ã  limiter autant que possible les dÃ©placements de leurs collaborateurs et salariÃ©s.
Il est Ã©galement nÃ©cessaire de sÃ©curiser les chantiers et le matÃ©riel en prÃ©vision.
Le niveau dâ€™alerte rouge Â« je me confine Â» sera dÃ©clenchÃ© en fonction de lâ€™Ã©volution de la situation.

author: Jordan West
title: Lunar Eclipse: The Blood Worm Moon will shine across Alabama
text:
Lunar Eclipse: The Blood Worm Moon will shine across Alabama
Blood Worm Moon: A Total Lunar Eclipse returns to Alabama
Blood Worm Moon: A Total Lunar Eclipse returns to Alabama
Blood Worm Moon: A Total Lunar Eclipse returns to Alabama
Set your alarms for 1:30 a.m. Friday morning!
If you've ever wanted to see a "blood moon," Friday morning's partial lunar eclipse is your chance. But you'll have to be an early bird, or rather, a very late night owl.
Here's the lowdown:
TIMING IS KEY
If I were you, I'd set my alarms for 1:30 a.m. Friday morning. That's when the moon will be at its reddest, according to astronomical forecasts.
The partial eclipse actually begins earlier, with the moon slowly taking on a reddish tint. But 1:30 a.m. is when the entire moon turns that deep, crimson hue.
The red tint will be brightest around 2:00 a.m., before it starts to fade around 2:30 a.m. The moon will return to its normal appearance by about 3:45 a.m.
SO WHAT'S HAPPENING?
A lunar eclipse occurs when the Earth passes directly between the sun and the moon, blocking the sun's light from reaching the moon. You can think of it as the moon having a hard time seeing sunlight.
BUT WHY RED?
This is where it gets interesting. The Earth doesn't completely block all sunlight from reaching the moon; it just blocks most of it.
Here's the science: The remaining sunlight that does reach the moon has to pass through Earth's atmosphere. As those rays travel through the atmosphere, the nitrogen and oxygen molecules scatter and filter out the blue wavelengths of light. This is the same reason our sky appears blue.
What's left? The longer wavelengths of light, like yellow, orange, and predominantly red, push through the atmosphere and shine onto the moon.
THE RESULT: A RED MOON
In short, the moon appears red during a lunar eclipse because Earth's atmosphere filters out the blue light from the sun, leaving mostly red light to illuminate the moon.
So, if you're up for a late-night celestial show, set those alarms and get ready to witness a stunning red moon. Just remember to grab a blanket and maybe a cup of coffee.
CLOUDS?
Unfortunately, for those of us in Alabama, the forecast isn't looking entirely cooperative. We'll be dealing with close to overcast skies by 2:00 a.m., right around the peak of the eclipse. That means that while the "blood moon" will be happening, whether or not we'll actually see it is up to mother nature.
Keep an eye on the latest forecasts as the time gets closer, and if you're really determined, maybe scout out a location with a slightly clearer view, or just hope for a break in the clouds. Even if you can't get a crystal-clear look, knowing that the celestial event is unfolding above the clouds can be a pretty cool experience in itself.
